channel.title: Programming on norbix.dev - The log of my journey through code & software systems architecture
channel.description: Recent content in Programming on norbix.dev - The log of my journey through code & software systems architecture

item.title: GoF Design Patterns in Go: Practical Examples
item.description: Explore the 23 Gang of Four (GoF) design patterns in Go with clear explanations and code snippets, grouped into creational, structural, and behavioral categories.

item.title: The Generic Protocol Pattern in Go: Designing Extensible CLI Interfaces
item.description: Learn how to implement a flexible and extensible protocol pattern in Go for building structured CLI interfaces and stream-based IPC communication.

item.title: Architectural Patterns in Go: MVC, Hexagonal, CQRS, and Microservices
item.description: Understand the difference between design patterns and architectural patterns. Explore how MVC, Hexagonal, CQRS, and Microservices can be applied in Go projects with practical insights and examples.

item.title: REST vs GraphQL vs WebSocket vs gRPC: API Styles and Contracts in Go
item.description: From REST to GraphQL, WebSocket, and gRPC â€” explore API communication patterns and how contracts like OpenAPI, Swagger, and Protobuf shape modern Go systems.

item.title: Enterprise Integration Patterns in Go: Practical Examples
item.description: Explore key Enterprise Integration Patterns (EIP) with practical Go examples, covering point-to-point, pub/sub, queues, and event-driven design for distributed systems.
